1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

BWC Goldberg has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, BWC Goldberg continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved BWC Goldberg's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that BWC Goldberg's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

BWC Goldberg has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, BWC Goldberg has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

BWC Goldberg has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia fertilizer process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia fertilizer process at the BWC Goldberg facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 58,000 (LBS). It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our personnel monitor the ammonia fertilizer process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

BWC Goldberg has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Buttonwillow Warehouse Company operates a fertilizer storage and resale location named Goldberg. BWC Goldberg is a fertilizer storage and resale facility. The ammonia process operates as follows. Ammonia is supplied by a vendor into the ammonia storage tank. From there it is stored until a sale is made, at which time a BWC Goldberg employee transfers ammonia from the storage tank into a smaller trailer-mounted nurse tank. The nurse tanks are towed by trucks off site for the fertilizer application.

1.2.2 Facility Location

BWC Goldberg is located on Pueblo Ave., 6.1 miles west of 12th Avenue  Corcoran, CA 93212. The latitude and longitude of the ammonia storage tank is 36.079348, -119.789417. The facility is located approximately 7.3 miles east of state highway 41 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is not located in a special flood hazard area.
BWC Goldberg is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that BWC Goldberg had a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Process Classification
The ammonia process at BWC Goldberg consists of a single storage vessel. Therefore, the ammonia storage vessel is treated as a single process.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities.
